channel.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
channel.description: I'm suspecting that my machine is running a little high. Are there programs I'm supposed to install to monitor my laptop's temperature (any suggestions)? And how would I know the temp is in the safe range? Thanks.

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: vasquezkelley
item.description:
It is so easy thing to check your laptop temperature. It is a software which is inbuilt in your laptop. The another way to check laptop temperature is just right click on your laptop desktop than select personalize and gazettes option. From that you can know your laptop temperature. You can also download temperature software form Internet.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I check my laptop's temperature?

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
haha my mates 1 core shitty laptop he got with a mobile contract runs at roughly 60-80 degress celcius, and i saw reach 101 before was an AMD sempron.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I check my laptop's temperature?

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: robinmarkk
item.description:
Temperature software are in built software in Laptop. If you want to check your Laptop temperature than just right click on your desktop and select personalize and gazettes option. If you have no option in your laptop like this than just download the temperature software from Internet.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
The fan on my Toshina laptop died one year into owning it.

Fun fact; Exactly a year later(now) it’s died for a second time. And they want £150+ to repair it through them? So much for ever buying Toshiba products ever again…

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: BaTz281
item.description:
Combine:

Thanks for the advice. Using the latter suggestion (HWMonitor seems the only program I know how to use) I came up with this. Any problems with the temperatures?

Yeah those numbers are very good, actually. Anytime your CPU is around 100°F (I assume that was idle) you should be happy. Hard drive is good for a laptop (desktops are usually in the low 30sC).

Read full topic

item.title: How do I check my laptop's temperature?
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Seriously though,

pfannkuchen_gesicht:

Lavalys Everest Ultimate or RivaTuner

^this. Yo can also check the CPU temp in BIOS.

Zageron:

https://www.piriform.com/speccy
New, small, quick, easy.

Just tried it. Wont show my CPU temp. GPU and HDD temps match with Everest.

Read full topic
